oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alternative fungicides to control apple scab in organic apple production: results of an orchard trial in 2003
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lindhard, Hanne
Paaske, Klaus
Bengtsson, Marianne V.
Hockenhull, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Apple scab, caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis, is the disease that most often decreases yield and causes loss of fruit quality in organic apple production. Damage to the fruits consists of brown to black spots, but in some years and on some varieties attacks can result in small misshapen fruits, that are totally unsuitable for fresh consumption.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Lindhard, Hanne; Paaske, Klaus; Bengtsson, Marianne V. and Hockenhull, John (2004) Alternative fungicides to control apple scab in organic apple production: results of an orchard trial in 2003. DARCOFenews (2).
